summary.name: summary
summary.value: Unable to retrieve metadata from pdf using Zend_Pdf

description.name: description
description.value:
Have successfully created PDF using Zend_Pdf, but cannot retrieve metadata.  The code:
$pdf = Zend_Pdf::load($pdfPath);  //I can open this PDF and am able to see and save the xmp
$metadata = $pdf->getMetadata();  //$metadata is null

The xmp file, saved from the xmp dialogue box after opening the PDF is:

<?xpacket begin="ï»¿" id="W5M0MpCehiHzreSzNTczkc9d"?>
<x:xmpmeta xmlns:x="adobe:ns:meta/" x:xmptk="Adobe XMP Core 4.2.1-c041 52.342996, 2008/05/07-20:48:00        ">
   <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#">
      <rdf:Description rdf:about=""
            xmlns:pdf="http://ns.adobe.com/pdf/1.3/">
         <pdf:CreationDate--Text>D:201105030111-08'00'</pdf:CreationDate--Text>
         <pdf:Keywords>XMP Username</pdf:Keywords>
         <pdf:Producer>XMP Producer</pdf:Producer>
      </rdf:Description>
      <rdf:Description rdf:about=""
            xmlns:xmp="http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/">
         <xmp:CreatorTool>XMP TheraScan</xmp:CreatorTool>
         <xmp:ModifyDate>2011-05-08T13:54:53Z</xmp:ModifyDate>
      </rdf:Description>
      <rdf:Description rdf:about=""
            xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">
         <dc:creator>
            <rdf:Seq>
               <rdf:li>XMP Therapeias Health Management</rdf:li>
            </rdf:Seq>
         </dc:creator>
         <dc:description>
            <rdf:Alt>
               <rdf:li xml:lang="x-default">XMP Subject</rdf:li>
            </rdf:Alt>
         </dc:description>
         <dc:title>
            <rdf:Alt>
               <rdf:li xml:lang="x-default">batch6747.pdf</rdf:li>
            </rdf:Alt>
         </dc:title>
         <dc:subject>
            <rdf:Bag>
               <rdf:li>XMP Username</rdf:li>
            </rdf:Bag>
         </dc:subject>
      </rdf:Description>
   </rdf:RDF>
</x:xmpmeta>

value.name: Zend_Pdf
value.description: pure PHP manipulation engine for composing PDFs

value.body: Is this still an issue?  Can you supply us with the actual PDF so we can reproduce the issue?
